00048 #define OBD_STATFS_NODELAY      0x0001  /* requests should be send without delay
00049                                          * and resends for avoid deadlocks */
00050 #define OBD_STATFS_FROM_CACHE   0x0002  /* the statfs callback should not update
00051                                          * obd_osfs_age */
00052 #define OBD_STATFS_PTLRPCD      0x0004  /* requests will be sent via ptlrpcd
00053                                          * instead of a specific set. This
00054                                          * means that we cannot rely on the set
00055                                          * interpret routine to be called.
00056                                          * lov_statfs_fini() must thus be called
00057                                          * by the request interpret routine */
00058 #define OBD_STATFS_FOR_MDT0     0x0008  /* The statfs is only for retrieving
00059                                          * information from MDT0. */

00165 #define CFG_F_COMPAT146 0x08   /* Allow old-style logs */
00166 #define CFG_F_EXCLUDE   0x10   /* OST exclusion list */

00194 struct config_llog_data {

00197         struct list_head            cld_list_chain;
00198         atomic_t                    cld_refcount;
00199         struct config_llog_data    *cld_sptlrpc;/* depended sptlrpc log */

00206                                                      * watching */
00207                                     cld_lostlock:1; /* lock not requeued */

00209 };

00228 void __class_export_add_lock_ref(struct obd_export *, struct ldlm_lock *);
00229 void __class_export_del_lock_ref(struct obd_export *, struct ldlm_lock *);
00230 extern void (*class_export_dump_hook)(struct obd_export *);

00232 #else
00233 
00234 #define __class_export_add_lock_ref(exp, lock)             do {} while(0)
00235 #define __class_export_del_lock_ref(exp, lock)             do {} while(0)

00239 #define class_export_rpc_inc(exp)                                       \
00240 ({                                                                      \
00241         atomic_inc(&(exp)->exp_rpc_count);                              \
00242         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "RPC GETting export %p : new rpc_count %d\n",    \
00243                (exp), atomic_read(&(exp)->exp_rpc_count));              \
00244 })
00245 
00246 #define class_export_rpc_dec(exp)                                       \
00247 ({                                                                      \
00248         LASSERT_ATOMIC_POS(&exp->exp_rpc_count);                        \
00249         atomic_dec(&(exp)->exp_rpc_count);                              \
00250         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "RPC PUTting export %p : new rpc_count %d\n",    \
00251                (exp), atomic_read(&(exp)->exp_rpc_count));              \
00252 })
00253 
00254 #define class_export_lock_get(exp, lock)                                \
00255 ({                                                                      \
00256         atomic_inc(&(exp)->exp_locks_count);                            \
00257         __class_export_add_lock_ref(exp, lock);                         \
00258         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "lock GETting export %p : new locks_count %d\n", \
00259                (exp), atomic_read(&(exp)->exp_locks_count));            \
00260         class_export_get(exp);                                          \
00261 })
00262 
00263 #define class_export_lock_put(exp, lock)                                \
00264 ({                                                                      \
00265         LASSERT_ATOMIC_POS(&exp->exp_locks_count);                      \
00266         atomic_dec(&(exp)->exp_locks_count);                            \
00267         __class_export_del_lock_ref(exp, lock);                         \
00268         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "lock PUTting export %p : new locks_count %d\n", \
00269                (exp), atomic_read(&(exp)->exp_locks_count));            \
00270         class_export_put(exp);                                          \
00271 })
00272 
00273 #define class_export_cb_get(exp)                                        \
00274 ({                                                                      \
00275         atomic_inc(&(exp)->exp_cb_count);                               \
00276         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "callback GETting export %p : new cb_count %d\n",\
00277                (exp), atomic_read(&(exp)->exp_cb_count));               \
00278         class_export_get(exp);                                          \
00279 })
00280 
00281 #define class_export_cb_put(exp)                                        \
00282 ({                                                                      \
00283         LASSERT_ATOMIC_POS(&exp->exp_cb_count);                         \
00284         atomic_dec(&(exp)->exp_cb_count);                               \
00285         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "callback PUTting export %p : new cb_count %d\n",\
00286                (exp), atomic_read(&(exp)->exp_cb_count));               \
00287         class_export_put(exp);                                          \
00288 })

00314 static inline enum obd_option exp_flags_from_obd(struct obd_device *obd)
00315 {
00316         return ((obd->obd_fail ? OBD_OPT_FAILOVER : 0) |
00317                 (obd->obd_force ? OBD_OPT_FORCE : 0) |
00318                 (obd->obd_abort_recovery ? OBD_OPT_ABORT_RECOV : 0) |
00319                 0);
00320 }

00322 #ifdef HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT
00323 static inline struct lu_target *class_exp2tgt(struct obd_export *exp)
00324 {
00325         LASSERT(exp->exp_obd);
00326         if (exp->exp_obd->u.obt.obt_magic != OBT_MAGIC)
00327                 return NULL;
00328         return exp->exp_obd->u.obt.obt_lut;
00329 }
00330 
00331 static inline struct lr_server_data *class_server_data(struct obd_device *obd)
00332 {
00333         LASSERT(obd->u.obt.obt_lut);
00334         return &obd->u.obt.obt_lut->lut_lsd;
00335 }
00336 #endif

00348 #define OBT(dev)        (dev)->obd_type
00349 #define OBP(dev, op)    (dev)->obd_type->typ_dt_ops->o_ ## op
00350 #define MDP(dev, op)    (dev)->obd_type->typ_md_ops->m_ ## op
00351 #define CTXTP(ctxt, op) (ctxt)->loc_logops->lop_##op
00352 
00353 /* Ensure obd_setup: used for cleanup which must be called
00354    while obd is stopping */
00355 #define OBD_CHECK_DEV(obd)                                      \
00356 do {                                                            \
00357         if (!(obd)) {                                           \
00358                 CERROR("NULL device\n");                        \
00359                 RETURN(-ENODEV);                                \
00360         }                                                       \
00361 } while (0)
00362 
00363 /* ensure obd_setup and !obd_stopping */
00364 #define OBD_CHECK_DEV_ACTIVE(obd)                               \
00365 do {                                                            \
00366         OBD_CHECK_DEV(obd);                                     \
00367         if (!(obd)->obd_set_up || (obd)->obd_stopping) {        \
00368                 CERROR("Device %d not setup\n",                 \
00369                        (obd)->obd_minor);                       \
00370                 RETURN(-ENODEV);                                \
00371         }                                                       \
00372 } while (0)
00373 
00374 
00375 #ifdef CONFIG_PROC_FS
00376 #define OBD_COUNTER_OFFSET(op)                                                 \
00377         ((offsetof(struct obd_ops, o_ ## op) -                                 \
00378           offsetof(struct obd_ops, o_iocontrol))                               \
00379          / sizeof(((struct obd_ops *)NULL)->o_iocontrol))
00380 
00381 /* The '- 1' below is for o_owner. */
00382 #define NUM_OBD_STATS                                                          \
00383         (sizeof(struct obd_ops) /                                              \
00384          sizeof(((struct obd_ops *)NULL)->o_iocontrol) - 1)
00385 
00386 #define OBD_COUNTER_INCREMENT(obd, op)                                         \
00387         lprocfs_counter_incr((obd)->obd_stats,                                 \
00388                              (obd)->obd_cntr_base + OBD_COUNTER_OFFSET(op))
00389 
00390 #define EXP_COUNTER_INCREMENT(exp, op)                                         \
00391         do {                                                                   \
00392                 unsigned int _off;                                             \
00393                 _off = (exp)->exp_obd->obd_cntr_base + OBD_COUNTER_OFFSET(op); \
00394                 lprocfs_counter_incr((exp)->exp_obd->obd_stats, _off);         \
00395                 if ((exp)->exp_obd->obd_uses_nid_stats &&                      \
00396                     (exp)->exp_nid_stats != NULL)                              \
00397                         lprocfs_counter_incr((exp)->exp_nid_stats->nid_stats,  \
00398                                              _off);                            \
00399         } while (0)
00400 
00401 #define _MD_COUNTER_OFFSET(m_op)                                               \
00402         ((offsetof(struct md_ops, m_op) -                                      \
00403           offsetof(struct md_ops, MD_STATS_FIRST_OP)) /                        \
00404          sizeof(((struct md_ops *)NULL)->MD_STATS_FIRST_OP))
00405 
00406 #define MD_COUNTER_OFFSET(op) _MD_COUNTER_OFFSET(m_ ## op)
00407 
00408 #define NUM_MD_STATS                                                           \
00409         (_MD_COUNTER_OFFSET(MD_STATS_LAST_OP) -                                \
00410          _MD_COUNTER_OFFSET(MD_STATS_FIRST_OP) + 1)
00411 
00412 /* Note that we only increment md counters for ops whose offset is less
00413  * than NUM_MD_STATS. This is explained in a comment in the definition
00414  * of struct md_ops. */
00415 #define EXP_MD_COUNTER_INCREMENT(exp, op)                                      \
00416         do {                                                                   \
00417                 if (MD_COUNTER_OFFSET(op) < NUM_MD_STATS)                      \
00418                         lprocfs_counter_incr((exp)->exp_obd->obd_md_stats,     \
00419                                         (exp)->exp_obd->obd_md_cntr_base +     \
00420                                         MD_COUNTER_OFFSET(op));                \
00421         } while (0)
00422 
00423 #else
00424 #define OBD_COUNTER_OFFSET(op)
00425 #define OBD_COUNTER_INCREMENT(obd, op)
00426 #define EXP_COUNTER_INCREMENT(exp, op)
00427 #define EXP_MD_COUNTER_INCREMENT(exp, op)
00428 #endif
00429 
00430 static inline int lprocfs_nid_ldlm_stats_init(struct nid_stat* tmp)
00431 {
00432         /* Always add in ldlm_stats */
00433         tmp->nid_ldlm_stats = lprocfs_alloc_stats(LDLM_LAST_OPC - LDLM_FIRST_OPC
00434                                                   ,LPROCFS_STATS_FLAG_NOPERCPU);
00435         if (tmp->nid_ldlm_stats == NULL)
00436                 return -ENOMEM;
00437 
00438         lprocfs_init_ldlm_stats(tmp->nid_ldlm_stats);
00439 
00440         return lprocfs_register_stats(tmp->nid_proc, "ldlm_stats",
00441                                       tmp->nid_ldlm_stats);
00442 }
00443 
00444 #define EXP_CHECK_MD_OP(exp, op)                                \
00445 do {                                                            \
00446         if ((exp) == NULL) {                                    \
00447                 CERROR("obd_" #op ": NULL export\n");           \
00448                 RETURN(-ENODEV);                                \
00449         }                                                       \
00450         if ((exp)->exp_obd == NULL || !OBT((exp)->exp_obd)) {   \
00451                 CERROR("obd_" #op ": cleaned up obd\n");        \
00452                 RETURN(-EOPNOTSUPP);                            \
00453         }                                                       \
00454         if (!OBT((exp)->exp_obd) || !MDP((exp)->exp_obd, op)) { \
00455                 CERROR("obd_" #op ": dev %s/%d no operation\n", \
00456                        (exp)->exp_obd->obd_name,                \
00457                        (exp)->exp_obd->obd_minor);              \
00458                 RETURN(-EOPNOTSUPP);                            \
00459         }                                                       \
00460 } while (0)
00461 
00462 
00463 #define OBD_CHECK_DT_OP(obd, op, err)                           \
00464 do {                                                            \
00465         if (!OBT(obd) || !OBP((obd), op)) {                     \
00466                 if (err)                                        \
00467                         CERROR("obd_" #op ": dev %d no operation\n",    \
00468                                obd->obd_minor);                 \
00469                 RETURN(err);                                    \
00470         }                                                       \
00471 } while (0)
00472 
00473 #define EXP_CHECK_DT_OP(exp, op)                                \
00474 do {                                                            \
00475         if ((exp) == NULL) {                                    \
00476                 CERROR("obd_" #op ": NULL export\n");           \
00477                 RETURN(-ENODEV);                                \
00478         }                                                       \
00479         if ((exp)->exp_obd == NULL || !OBT((exp)->exp_obd)) {   \
00480                 CERROR("obd_" #op ": cleaned up obd\n");        \
00481                 RETURN(-EOPNOTSUPP);                            \
00482         }                                                       \
00483         if (!OBT((exp)->exp_obd) || !OBP((exp)->exp_obd, op)) { \
00484                 CERROR("obd_" #op ": dev %d no operation\n",    \
00485                        (exp)->exp_obd->obd_minor);              \
00486                 RETURN(-EOPNOTSUPP);                            \
00487         }                                                       \
00488 } while (0)
00489 
00490 #define CTXT_CHECK_OP(ctxt, op, err)                                 \
00491 do {                                                                 \
00492         if (!OBT(ctxt->loc_obd) || !CTXTP((ctxt), op)) {             \
00493                 if (err)                                             \
00494                         CERROR("lop_" #op ": dev %d no operation\n", \
00495                                ctxt->loc_obd->obd_minor);            \
00496                 RETURN(err);                                         \
00497         }                                                            \
00498 } while (0)
00499 
00500 static inline int class_devno_max(void)
00501 {
00502         return MAX_OBD_DEVICES;
00503 }
00504

00535 
00536 /*
00537  * obd-lu integration.
00538  *
00539  * Functionality is being moved into new lu_device-based layering, but some
00540  * pieces of configuration process are still based on obd devices.
00541  *
00542  * Specifically, lu_device_type_operations::ldto_device_alloc() methods fully
00543  * subsume ->o_setup() methods of obd devices they replace. The same for
00544  * lu_device_operations::ldo_process_config() and ->o_process_config(). As a
00545  * result, obd_setup() and obd_process_config() branch and call one XOR
00546  * another.
00547  *
00548  * Yet neither lu_device_type_operations::ldto_device_fini() nor
00549  * lu_device_type_operations::ldto_device_free() fully implement the
00550  * functionality of ->o_precleanup() and ->o_cleanup() they override. Hence,
00551  * obd_precleanup() and obd_cleanup() call both lu_device and obd operations.
00552  */
00553 
00554 #define DECLARE_LU_VARS(ldt, d)                 \
00555         struct lu_device_type *ldt;       \
00556         struct lu_device *d
00557 
00558 static inline int obd_setup(struct obd_device *obd, struct lustre_cfg *cfg)
00559 {
00560         int rc;
00561         DECLARE_LU_VARS(ldt, d);
00562         ENTRY;
00563 
00564         ldt = obd->obd_type->typ_lu;
00565         if (ldt != NULL) {
00566                 struct lu_context  session_ctx;
00567                 struct lu_env env;
00568                 lu_context_init(&session_ctx, LCT_SESSION | LCT_SERVER_SESSION);
00569                 session_ctx.lc_thread = NULL;
00570                 lu_context_enter(&session_ctx);
00571 
00572                 rc = lu_env_init(&env, ldt->ldt_ctx_tags);
00573                 if (rc == 0) {
00574                         env.le_ses = &session_ctx;
00575                         d = ldt->ldt_ops->ldto_device_alloc(&env, ldt, cfg);
00576                         lu_env_fini(&env);
00577                         if (!IS_ERR(d)) {
00578                                 obd->obd_lu_dev = d;
00579                                 d->ld_obd = obd;
00580                                 rc = 0;
00581                         } else
00582                                 rc = PTR_ERR(d);
00583                 }
00584                 lu_context_exit(&session_ctx);
00585                 lu_context_fini(&session_ctx);
00586 
00587         } else {
00588                 OBD_CHECK_DT_OP(obd, setup, -EOPNOTSUPP);
00589                 OBD_COUNTER_INCREMENT(obd, setup);
00590                 rc = OBP(obd, setup)(obd, cfg);
00591         }
00592         RETURN(rc);
00593 }
00594 
00595 static inline int obd_precleanup(struct obd_device *obd)
00596 {
00597         int rc;
00598         DECLARE_LU_VARS(ldt, d);
00599         ENTRY;
00600 
00601         OBD_CHECK_DEV(obd);
00602         ldt = obd->obd_type->typ_lu;
00603         d = obd->obd_lu_dev;
00604         if (ldt != NULL && d != NULL) {
00605                 struct lu_env env;
00606 
00607                 rc = lu_env_init(&env, ldt->ldt_ctx_tags);
00608                 if (rc == 0) {
00609                         ldt->ldt_ops->ldto_device_fini(&env, d);
00610                         lu_env_fini(&env);
00611                 }
00612         }
00613         OBD_CHECK_DT_OP(obd, precleanup, 0);
00614         OBD_COUNTER_INCREMENT(obd, precleanup);
00615 
00616         rc = OBP(obd, precleanup)(obd);
00617         RETURN(rc);
00618 }
00619 
00620 static inline int obd_cleanup(struct obd_device *obd)
00621 {
00622         int rc;
00623         DECLARE_LU_VARS(ldt, d);
00624         ENTRY;
00625 
00626         OBD_CHECK_DEV(obd);
00627 
00628         ldt = obd->obd_type->typ_lu;
00629         d = obd->obd_lu_dev;
00630         if (ldt != NULL && d != NULL) {
00631                 struct lu_env env;
00632 
00633                 rc = lu_env_init(&env, ldt->ldt_ctx_tags);
00634                 if (rc == 0) {
00635                         ldt->ldt_ops->ldto_device_free(&env, d);
00636                         lu_env_fini(&env);
00637                         obd->obd_lu_dev = NULL;
00638                 }
00639         }
00640         OBD_CHECK_DT_OP(obd, cleanup, 0);
00641         OBD_COUNTER_INCREMENT(obd, cleanup);
00642 
00643         rc = OBP(obd, cleanup)(obd);
00644         RETURN(rc);
00645 }
00646 
00647 static inline void obd_cleanup_client_import(struct obd_device *obd)
00648 {
00649         ENTRY;
00650 
00651         /* If we set up but never connected, the
00652            client import will not have been cleaned. */
00653         down_write(&obd->u.cli.cl_sem);
00654         if (obd->u.cli.cl_import) {
00655                 struct obd_import *imp;
00656                 imp = obd->u.cli.cl_import;
00657                 CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "%s: client import never connected\n",
00658                        obd->obd_name);
00659                 ptlrpc_invalidate_import(imp);
00660                 client_destroy_import(imp);
00661                 obd->u.cli.cl_import = NULL;
00662         }
00663         up_write(&obd->u.cli.cl_sem);
00664 
00665         EXIT;
00666 }
00667 
00668 static inline int
00669 obd_process_config(struct obd_device *obd, int datalen, void *data)
00670 {
00671         int rc;
00672         DECLARE_LU_VARS(ldt, d);
00673         ENTRY;
00674 
00675         OBD_CHECK_DEV(obd);
00676 
00677         obd->obd_process_conf = 1;
00678         ldt = obd->obd_type->typ_lu;
00679         d = obd->obd_lu_dev;
00680         if (ldt != NULL && d != NULL) {
00681                 struct lu_env env;
00682 
00683                 rc = lu_env_init(&env, ldt->ldt_ctx_tags);
00684                 if (rc == 0) {
00685                         rc = d->ld_ops->ldo_process_config(&env, d, data);
00686                         lu_env_fini(&env);
00687                 }
00688         } else {
00689                 OBD_CHECK_DT_OP(obd, process_config, -EOPNOTSUPP);
00690                 rc = OBP(obd, process_config)(obd, datalen, data);
00691         }
00692         OBD_COUNTER_INCREMENT(obd, process_config);
00693         obd->obd_process_conf = 0;
00694 
00695         RETURN(rc);
00696 }

00796 static inline int obd_connect(const struct lu_env *env,
00797                               struct obd_export **exp,struct obd_device *obd,
00798                               struct obd_uuid *cluuid,
00799                               struct obd_connect_data *data,
00800                               void *localdata)
00801 {
00802         int rc;
00803         __u64 ocf = data ? data->ocd_connect_flags : 0; /* for post-condition
00804                                                    * check */
00805         ENTRY;
00806 
00807         OBD_CHECK_DEV_ACTIVE(obd);
00808         OBD_CHECK_DT_OP(obd, connect, -EOPNOTSUPP);
00809         OBD_COUNTER_INCREMENT(obd, connect);
00810 
00811         rc = OBP(obd, connect)(env, exp, obd, cluuid, data, localdata);
00812         /* check that only subset is granted */
00813         LASSERT(ergo(data != NULL, (data->ocd_connect_flags & ocf) ==
00814                                     data->ocd_connect_flags));
00815         RETURN(rc);
00816 }
00817 
00818 static inline int obd_reconnect(const struct lu_env *env,
00819                                 struct obd_export *exp,
00820                                 struct obd_device *obd,
00821                                 struct obd_uuid *cluuid,
00822                                 struct obd_connect_data *d,
00823                                 void *localdata)
00824 {
00825         int rc;
00826         __u64 ocf = d ? d->ocd_connect_flags : 0; /* for post-condition
00827                                                    * check */
00828 
00829         ENTRY;
00830 
00831         OBD_CHECK_DEV_ACTIVE(obd);
00832         OBD_CHECK_DT_OP(obd, reconnect, 0);
00833         OBD_COUNTER_INCREMENT(obd, reconnect);
00834 
00835         rc = OBP(obd, reconnect)(env, exp, obd, cluuid, d, localdata);
00836         /* check that only subset is granted */
00837         LASSERT(ergo(d != NULL,
00838                      (d->ocd_connect_flags & ocf) == d->ocd_connect_flags));
00839         RETURN(rc);
00840 }

00974 static inline int obd_init_export(struct obd_export *exp)
00975 {
00976         int rc = 0;
00977 
00978         ENTRY;
00979         if ((exp)->exp_obd != NULL && OBT((exp)->exp_obd) &&
00980             OBP((exp)->exp_obd, init_export))
00981                 rc = OBP(exp->exp_obd, init_export)(exp);
00982         RETURN(rc);
00983 }
00984 
00985 static inline int obd_destroy_export(struct obd_export *exp)
00986 {
00987         ENTRY;
00988         if ((exp)->exp_obd != NULL && OBT((exp)->exp_obd) &&
00989             OBP((exp)->exp_obd, destroy_export))
00990                 OBP(exp->exp_obd, destroy_export)(exp);
00991         RETURN(0);
00992 }
00993 
00994 /* @max_age is the oldest time in jiffies that we accept using a cached data.
00995  * If the cache is older than @max_age we will get a new value from the
00996  * target.  Use a value of "cfs_time_current() + HZ" to guarantee freshness. */
00997 static inline int obd_statfs_async(struct obd_export *exp,
00998                                    struct obd_info *oinfo,
00999                                    __u64 max_age,
01000                                    struct ptlrpc_request_set *rqset)
01001 {
01002         int rc = 0;
01003         struct obd_device *obd;
01004         ENTRY;
01005 
01006         if (exp == NULL || exp->exp_obd == NULL)
01007                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
01008 
01009         obd = exp->exp_obd;
01010         OBD_CHECK_DT_OP(obd, statfs, -EOPNOTSUPP);
01011         OBD_COUNTER_INCREMENT(obd, statfs);
01012 
01013         CDEBUG(D_SUPER, "%s: osfs %p age "LPU64", max_age "LPU64"\n",
01014                obd->obd_name, &obd->obd_osfs, obd->obd_osfs_age, max_age);
01015         if (cfs_time_before_64(obd->obd_osfs_age, max_age)) {
01016                 rc = OBP(obd, statfs_async)(exp, oinfo, max_age, rqset);
01017         } else {
01018                 CDEBUG(D_SUPER,"%s: use %p cache blocks "LPU64"/"LPU64
01019                        " objects "LPU64"/"LPU64"\n",
01020                        obd->obd_name, &obd->obd_osfs,
01021                        obd->obd_osfs.os_bavail, obd->obd_osfs.os_blocks,
01022                        obd->obd_osfs.os_ffree, obd->obd_osfs.os_files);
01023                 spin_lock(&obd->obd_osfs_lock);
01024                 memcpy(oinfo->oi_osfs, &obd->obd_osfs, sizeof(*oinfo->oi_osfs));
01025                 spin_unlock(&obd->obd_osfs_lock);
01026                 oinfo->oi_flags |= OBD_STATFS_FROM_CACHE;
01027                 if (oinfo->oi_cb_up)
01028                         oinfo->oi_cb_up(oinfo, 0);
01029         }
01030         RETURN(rc);
01031 }
01032 
01033 static inline int obd_statfs_rqset(struct obd_export *exp,
01034                                    struct obd_statfs *osfs, __u64 max_age,
01035                                    __u32 flags)
01036 {
01037         struct ptlrpc_request_set *set = NULL;
01038         struct obd_info oinfo = {
01039                 .oi_osfs = osfs,
01040                 .oi_flags = flags,
01041         };
01042         int rc = 0;
01043 
01044         ENTRY;
01045 
01046         set = ptlrpc_prep_set();
01047         if (set == NULL)
01048                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01049 
01050         rc = obd_statfs_async(exp, &oinfo, max_age, set);
01051         if (rc == 0)
01052                 rc = ptlrpc_set_wait(set);
01053 
01054         ptlrpc_set_destroy(set);
01055 
01056         RETURN(rc);
01057 }
01058 
01059 /* @max_age is the oldest time in jiffies that we accept using a cached data.
01060  * If the cache is older than @max_age we will get a new value from the
01061  * target.  Use a value of "cfs_time_current() + HZ" to guarantee freshness. */
01062 static inline int obd_statfs(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_export *exp,
01063                              struct obd_statfs *osfs, __u64 max_age,
01064                              __u32 flags)
01065 {
01066         int rc = 0;
01067         struct obd_device *obd = exp->exp_obd;
01068         ENTRY;
01069 
01070         if (obd == NULL)
01071                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
01072 
01073         OBD_CHECK_DT_OP(obd, statfs, -EOPNOTSUPP);
01074         OBD_COUNTER_INCREMENT(obd, statfs);
01075 
01076         CDEBUG(D_SUPER, "osfs "LPU64", max_age "LPU64"\n",
01077                obd->obd_osfs_age, max_age);
01078         if (cfs_time_before_64(obd->obd_osfs_age, max_age)) {
01079                 rc = OBP(obd, statfs)(env, exp, osfs, max_age, flags);
01080                 if (rc == 0) {
01081                         spin_lock(&obd->obd_osfs_lock);
01082                         memcpy(&obd->obd_osfs, osfs, sizeof(obd->obd_osfs));
01083                         obd->obd_osfs_age = cfs_time_current_64();
01084                         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_osfs_lock);
01085                 }
01086         } else {
01087                 CDEBUG(D_SUPER, "%s: use %p cache blocks "LPU64"/"LPU64
01088                        " objects "LPU64"/"LPU64"\n",
01089                        obd->obd_name, &obd->obd_osfs,
01090                        obd->obd_osfs.os_bavail, obd->obd_osfs.os_blocks,
01091                        obd->obd_osfs.os_ffree, obd->obd_osfs.os_files);
01092                 spin_lock(&obd->obd_osfs_lock);
01093                 memcpy(osfs, &obd->obd_osfs, sizeof(*osfs));
01094                 spin_unlock(&obd->obd_osfs_lock);
01095         }
01096         RETURN(rc);
01097 }
01098 
01099 static inline int obd_preprw(const struct lu_env *env, int cmd,
01100                              struct obd_export *exp, struct obdo *oa,
01101                              int objcount, struct obd_ioobj *obj,
01102                              struct niobuf_remote *remote, int *pages,
01103                              struct niobuf_local *local)
01104 {
01105         int rc;
01106 
01107         ENTRY;
01108         EXP_CHECK_DT_OP(exp, preprw);
01109         EXP_COUNTER_INCREMENT(exp, preprw);
01110         rc = OBP(exp->exp_obd, preprw)(env, cmd, exp, oa, objcount, obj, remote,
01111                                        pages, local);
01112 
01113         RETURN(rc);
01114 }
01115 
01116 static inline int obd_commitrw(const struct lu_env *env, int cmd,
01117                                struct obd_export *exp, struct obdo *oa,
01118                                int objcount, struct obd_ioobj *obj,
01119                                struct niobuf_remote *rnb, int pages,
01120                                struct niobuf_local *local, int rc)
01121 {

01123

01125         EXP_COUNTER_INCREMENT(exp, commitrw);
01126         rc = OBP(exp->exp_obd, commitrw)(env, cmd, exp, oa, objcount, obj,
01127                                          rnb, pages, local, rc);
01128 
01129         RETURN(rc);
01130 }

01144 
01145 static inline void obd_import_event(struct obd_device *obd,
01146                                     struct obd_import *imp,
01147                                     enum obd_import_event event)
01148 {
01149         ENTRY;
01150         if (!obd) {
01151                 CERROR("NULL device\n");
01152                 EXIT;
01153                 return;
01154         }
01155         if (obd->obd_set_up && OBP(obd, import_event)) {
01156                 OBD_COUNTER_INCREMENT(obd, import_event);
01157                 OBP(obd, import_event)(obd, imp, event);
01158         }
01159         EXIT;
01160 }
01161 
01162 static inline int obd_notify(struct obd_device *obd,
01163                              struct obd_device *watched,
01164                              enum obd_notify_event ev,
01165                              void *data)
01166 {
01167         int rc;
01168         ENTRY;
01169         OBD_CHECK_DEV(obd);
01170 
01171         if (!obd->obd_set_up) {
01172                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "obd %s not set up\n", obd->obd_name);
01173                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
01174         }
01175 
01176         if (!OBP(obd, notify)) {
01177                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "obd %s has no notify handler\n", obd->obd_name);
01178                 RETURN(-ENOSYS);
01179         }
01180 
01181         OBD_COUNTER_INCREMENT(obd, notify);
01182         rc = OBP(obd, notify)(obd, watched, ev, data);
01183         RETURN(rc);
01184 }
01185 
01186 static inline int obd_notify_observer(struct obd_device *observer,
01187                                       struct obd_device *observed,
01188                                       enum obd_notify_event ev,
01189                                       void *data)
01190 {
01191         int rc1;
01192         int rc2;
01193 
01194         struct obd_notify_upcall *onu;
01195 
01196         if (observer->obd_observer)
01197                 rc1 = obd_notify(observer->obd_observer, observed, ev, data);
01198         else
01199                 rc1 = 0;
01200         /*
01201          * Also, call non-obd listener, if any
01202          */
01203         onu = &observer->obd_upcall;
01204         if (onu->onu_upcall != NULL)
01205                 rc2 = onu->onu_upcall(observer, observed, ev,
01206                                       onu->onu_owner, NULL);
01207         else
01208                 rc2 = 0;
01209 
01210         return rc1 ? rc1 : rc2;
01211 }
01212 
01213 static inline int obd_quotactl(struct obd_export *exp,
01214                                struct obd_quotactl *oqctl)
01215 {
01216         int rc;
01217         ENTRY;
01218 
01219         EXP_CHECK_DT_OP(exp, quotactl);
01220         EXP_COUNTER_INCREMENT(exp, quotactl);
01221 
01222         rc = OBP(exp->exp_obd, quotactl)(exp->exp_obd, exp, oqctl);
01223         RETURN(rc);
01224 }
01225 
01226 static inline int obd_health_check(const struct lu_env *env,
01227                                    struct obd_device *obd)
01228 {
01229         /* returns: 0 on healthy
01230          *         >0 on unhealthy + reason code/flag
01231          *            however the only suppored reason == 1 right now
01232          *            We'll need to define some better reasons
01233          *            or flags in the future.
01234          *         <0 on error
01235          */
01236         int rc;
01237         ENTRY;
01238 
01239         /* don't use EXP_CHECK_DT_OP, because NULL method is normal here */
01240         if (obd == NULL || !OBT(obd)) {
01241                 CERROR("cleaned up obd\n");
01242                 RETURN(-EOPNOTSUPP);
01243         }
01244         if (!obd->obd_set_up || obd->obd_stopping)
01245                 RETURN(0);
01246         if (!OBP(obd, health_check))
01247                 RETURN(0);
01248 
01249         rc = OBP(obd, health_check)(env, obd);
01250         RETURN(rc);
01251 }
01252 
01253 static inline int obd_register_observer(struct obd_device *obd,
01254                                         struct obd_device *observer)
01255 {
01256         ENTRY;
01257         OBD_CHECK_DEV(obd);
01258         down_write(&obd->obd_observer_link_sem);
01259         if (obd->obd_observer && observer) {
01260                 up_write(&obd->obd_observer_link_sem);
01261                 RETURN(-EALREADY);
01262         }
01263         obd->obd_observer = observer;
01264         up_write(&obd->obd_observer_link_sem);
01265         RETURN(0);
01266 }

01625 /* Unpack an MD struct from disk to in-memory format.
01626  * Returns +ve size of unpacked MD (0 for free), or -ve error.
01627  *
01628  * If *plsm != NULL and lmm == NULL then *lsm will be freed.
01629  * If *plsm == NULL then it will be allocated.
01630  */
01631 static inline int md_unpackmd(struct obd_export *exp,
01632                               struct lmv_stripe_md **plsm,
01633                               const union lmv_mds_md *lmm, size_t lmm_size)
01634 {
01635         int rc;
01636         ENTRY;
01637         EXP_CHECK_MD_OP(exp, unpackmd);
01638         EXP_MD_COUNTER_INCREMENT(exp, unpackmd);
01639         rc = MDP(exp->exp_obd, unpackmd)(exp, plsm, lmm, lmm_size);
01640         RETURN(rc);
01641 }

01645 extern int obd_init_caches(void);
01646 extern void obd_cleanup_caches(void);
01647 
01648 /* support routines */
01649 extern struct kmem_cache *obdo_cachep;
01650 
01651 #define OBDO_ALLOC(ptr)                                                       \
01652 do {                                                                          \
01653         OBD_SLAB_ALLOC_PTR_GFP((ptr), obdo_cachep, GFP_NOFS);             \
01654 } while(0)
01655 
01656 #define OBDO_FREE(ptr)                                                        \
01657 do {                                                                          \
01658         OBD_SLAB_FREE_PTR((ptr), obdo_cachep);                                \
01659 } while(0)

01662 typedef int (*register_lwp_cb)(void *data);
01663 
01664 struct lwp_register_item {
01665         struct obd_export **lri_exp;
01666         register_lwp_cb     lri_cb_func;
01667         void               *lri_cb_data;
01668         struct list_head    lri_list;
01669         atomic_t            lri_ref;
01670         char                lri_name[MTI_NAME_MAXLEN];
01671 };
